title: Rocky Mountain National Park: Research
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Management     Elk and Vegetation Management     Research                 Research - Elk and Vegetation Management        NPS/Ann Schonlau        By the end of the 20th century there was growing concern over the effects of abundant elk on vegetation conditions in the park.  This led to new research that informed the need for an Elk and Vegetation Management Plan. Ongoing research still guides the plan's implementation strategies used in the park.          Planning Research - 1994-2006            Current Research - Elk Population            Current Research - Vegetation           References and Glossary          Research that involves field work in Rocky Mountain National Park requires a research permit.  See the Continental Divide Research Learning Center website for more information about research in Rocky Mountain National Park.
